1.content:
The Jungle, Deepest Africa has nothing on this place. the vastness extends to the limits of comprehension. Trees growing over a hundred feet high at the edge, the interior is shielded in darkness. This is a adventure fit for any size. anything can be found, Riches, death, Freindship, Maybe even love. But for those who dare to embark into the Jungle there are many others likewise intent on finding the joys of the wilderness as are despicable enough to selfishly use it. Where will you go, who will you be? From simple villiages, to aztec style metropolises, to the pristine jungle itself. Anything is possible.


Character Choice one
1.title: Opening Character Choices

11.content: Your one of the big crew, little can touch you and that gave you one of a few positions, wanting to make others suffer as one but there are nice macros out there. All in all though You show power
11.title: SUV Model Characters

111.content:
Big and burly, a titanic creature of legendary strength and a handsome appearance. Your a stallion, an anthro horse who stands tall and proud above the tree tops. You've got a bit of an ego, and as your slightly swollen gut shows, alot of an appetite. There's nothing that you won't eat, though there are a few things that you prefer above all else; orchards, oat fields, humans, foxes, bears, rice, sweets, and smaller dragons.

Right now you're a wanderer, a titian who's traveled to a strange and unknown land in search of food and space. The last place you lived was so overcrowded that it could no longer physically sustain its self. Staying in a place like that for to long could cramp your style, and the pollution was doing nothing for your lovely tan coloured fur.

"It's good to be away from there" You muse to yourself aloud while you run your fingers through you're mane. Finally your coat is clean, you can stretch your legs, and get the stink of you. On top of that the local population is more pleasant then what you've grown used to. Everyone you've met around here has been polite, curtious, and quite tasty. You're really going to like living here.

You walk on until well past sunset, It's getting late and you're growing tired and hungry. Right now it seem like it might be a good idea to settle down for the night and maybe grab a bite to eat
111.title: From places afar

1111.content:
Right now you feel more tired than hungry, so you leave your evening meal for the next morning. This new place is quite comfortable, but you've always been very rigorous when it comes to sleep so you decide to pick up a nice place.

After some searching, you end up with two possible places to rest. One is a plain field with no trees. Actually, it's a pretty dull place with hard ground, which doesn't attract you too much but that, well, looks like a possibility.

The other one is a small village by the hill, a warm place which topology looks as if it was modeled to your body specifications. Just by looking at the place ou can see that your body will have a good night of sleep there. The only problem is that, well, there's a small village there, so you'll have to "deal" with the villagers. Which one you choose?
1111.title: A place to rest

11112.content:
Your body seems to be calling you to that comfortable place. Besides, you sense that it's gonna be somewwat funny to get your sleep there!

As you approach the village, you see one or two families coming out of their houses and staring at you in awe. Your presence has changed the mood of the village (and your body is right in front of the sunlight, so all they can see is your body casting shadows over the village).

Some of the families seem to like your presence there, as they wave to you and yeel happy words. one kid even dares to come right to your hoof to hug it, leaving you somewhat embarassed.

But then, the fact is. You're tired, and the village was built right where your 'bed' is supposed to be. What now?
11112.title: Warm welcome

choices: You decide to eat some of the villagers

They gave you a very warm welcome, but you know that they're gonna feel even warmer when they all get under your hoof.

You raise your left hoof slowly and start hovering it over one of the house, the one with the happiest family. The family is made of 2 parents and 4 children of different ages. They seem to be loving your presence there, and to see you getting closer to their home. What they don't like is the smell of your hoof. It seems that you've been a few weeks without anything that resembles a bath.

You find it a little weird that everybody loves you, and it is starting to build up some rage inside. Without thinking twice, you land your hoof with all your weight right over the happy family. You feel their bodies crumbling under your mighty hoof, and that good old feeling that you love: showing humans your body from pretty "close".

As you raise your foot, all that is left is their house completely flat on the ground, and their bodies stuck to your smelly hoof. You look around and see that the villagers are scared still, not beleieving that the mighty being they thought to be a friend is actually a wicked horse willing to stomp the village flat.

You then start randomly stepping on people's houses and bodies, crunching sounds and blood stains appearing all over the place...

Of course, this doesn't mean you have to be polite about it. After finding a nice clear embankment amongst the trees, you get comfortable in a reclining position and start to study your captive. Holding the wolf up by just one of his legs, you dangle him in front of your face as you look him over inquisitively. He's in good physical shape, has a healthy looking pelt, very well kempt. His dark hair is tied back in an unusually thick braid, with a couple of streaks of bright blues and purples showing up in his bangs. Quite odd that... some of his features are also unusually pointed, could it be that you've stumbled upon an elf blooded anthro? that would help to explain the odd colours and grooming habit.

Meh, doesn't really matter. Cute is cute, and this handsome creature looks ever so much cuter when he's swaying and flailing in your loose grasp. You flick him a couple of times with a spare digit, causing him to swing wildly. You grin and chuckle while he looks at you in horror, and tries to hold his lunch down.

Okay, maybe you should give that a rest. With a flick of the wrist the wolf is back into the stable grip of your palm, where he can settle his stomach and you can give him a proper going over.

So what now?

From the main door way leading out to the palace, you watch as it's shadow has covered the entire capital city. Each morning the citizens awake in the shadow of you home, letting them know who rules over them.

You hear the sound of a massive (to the commoners of course) cart, bearing your garments, coming towards you. It was being pulled by 10 horses, you used of 15, but they gotten a touch for stallion the other night and you feast on the five best ones in the palace.

You do not wear much, for why should you cover yourself since you a near a god. You place on your back a flowing red cape that stops right at your ankles. This simple garment took 20 acres of materials to make. The rope to tie it around your thick neck required half a forest to make. A "gift" when you proclaimed yourself lord of this land long ago. Along with your draping loincloth, this is when you are the most dress ever, not including the three pouches you carry with for this kind of visit in the city. Forged from several burlap sacks sown together seamlessly into larger ones. Each of them were suppose to carry a large mass of people back to your palace. One was for carrying criminals that would be given to you by your city guardsmen for their punishment. Another was to carry people you deemed fit to be servants for you, since you have a habit of killing them on accident or in rage. The last bag is for your personal pleasure, you claim any maiden, young or married, that you were attracted to and take them back so they can please you until you were weary of them. Fastening these bags to your waist you were ready to please your people.

You simply walk outside and closed your massive doors to your home yourself, sealing everyone inside until you open them again. You then walk down the path to the city, a stairway path you formed yourself to help ensure that invader knew what they would face.


You stroll down through the city, built to your exact ruling. All the buildings were below your eye level, for you decree that nothing in this world beside your castle can meet you size. The spacing in between them was also made for you to easily walk around them without destroying them… when you’re calm. When you were at least displeased with the people you would push a building over, or get a chuckle by sitting on one of them and have everyone inside be squash by your mighty backside.

Speaking the commoners, they all stop whatever they were doing before you grace them with you presence, and simply bowed at you as you pass them by, on the ground or in their dwellings or places of businesses. You tried your best not to step on any of the peasants outside on the ground; it would be a sin to kill anyone who is loyal to you with no reason to justify it. With each step you drop down to the earth, you cause a burst of air to spread out under them and cause dirt to spread around on the people and the buildings, but they didn’t got angry or annoyed by this. You ruled this place for countless generations, and to them, you are the one and only god to respect and revere. And nothing is going to change that.

12512.content:
You were once a proud and noble hunter. You had it all. The respect of your fellow tribesmen, a wide range of mates to choose from, wealth and power but above all of that was your size. You were a twenty foot tall male lion. Your fur glistened like gold and you were very buff and athletic, you were the best hunter in your tribe and the biggest anthro in your village. You truly were destined for greatness. You looked down on those who were weaker and smaller then you, and this did not earn you any friends and a ton of enemies, but nothing you couldn't handle. At least that's how you used to think. It was astonishing how easily your life changed for the worst.

Three months ago, your view of the world changed and you quickly realized how blessed you were too be twenty feet tall. You don't quite remember how it happened, but you will never forget that feeling of dread and fear when it did. It was the night before your wedding. You were marrying the chief's daughter and were going to take over the tribe on the day of your wedding. You remembered how amazing the feeling of being able to rule over your entire tribe felt, you were going to weed out the week and make your tribes name feared and praised as the best hunters across the land, but this glorious dream never happened.

You remember walking home from your night of celebration when suddenly you felt extremely sleepy. Your legs froze up and you collapsed right there on the road. When you came to you made a horrifying discovery. You had shrunk to a mere two inches. Even the children in your tribe could take you out easily at your new height. You realized that if your tribe ever found out, you would either be eaten, crushed or enslaved. Size and power meant everything to your tribe, if you were weak or small you were treated like an insect. The fear of being at the mercy of all those hunters who you mocked for being weaker then you, rose up and overtook you. You had to escape and leave everything you knew behind.

It wasn't easy but you managed to escape the grasp of the hunters and the anger of your tribe. They would have thought that you had deserted and were killed. When the sound of the horn came you knew that meant only one thing. The last hunt. It was a tradition to hunt down any deserters and execute them on the spot. It was only thanks to your skills that you managed to find a place to hide. Your tribe never found you and assumed you were dead. They packed up camp and left. It had been three months since then and the number of predators you had increased substantially, even insects could hunt you now, and your chance of survival was growing thinner each day.

The first month was the hardest. You had to find a steady food source. You hunted insects smaller then your self, and gathered supplies from your surroundings to fortify your new home, which was under a tree. It was a hard month, but eventually you got used to running from the many large predators and surviving on insects and berries. You had to trim your mane so that you could see danger from all sides, that would have been a problem in the past as your dignity and pride prevented you from doing so, but you kissed those goodbye when you had to eat the leavings of a bigger predator just to survive the week.

Your new life is a hard on but it is the only life you have. You hated living in constant fear that you were going to be eaten or crushed. You hated the cold, rainy nights living under a tree trying to prevent water from flooding your new home. You hated that you had to trim your mane and that your once golden fur was caked in mud from sleeping on the ground. Your clothes were torn to shreds and you didn't like that you were exposed to everything now but above all else you despised the fact that you were completely alone.As the days went by, you could only reminisce about your old life, for now you only lived to survive. You missed the luxuries you had, You missed the power you held in your tribe but above all else you missed your size.

Now the only reason you live each day is because your skills and a tremendous amount of luck. Luck that has finally run out. You raced across the forest floor desperately trying to escape your pursuer It was nothing but a common field mouse, but at your current size it might as well have been a rabid elephant. You glanced back and tripped. You tumbled across the ground till you can to a painful stop. You heard the sound of bones breaking and knew that one of your legs had just broke. You glanced back and saw your pursuer racing towards you, so this is how it ended. You closed your eyes and let out a small whimper as you waited for the end.

You felt something wrap around your waist and lift you upwards. You didn't dare open your eyes, you didn't want to see your killer. You landed with a small thud on something hard. You grimaced as you felt pain shoot through your leg. You waited, but nothing came, you waited still, but when your end didn't come. You opened your eyes. That's when you noticed you were laying in a giant scaly paw. Gulping, you turned your eyes upwards and a massive dragon was looking down at you.

132211.content:
You stand there frozen in fear as giant otters ransack the village. They were standing up to 10 feet tall on two stout legs and had soft brown fur that turned a more creamy color as it reached their front. Most of them were just wearing a loincloth that accented their curved bellies, some fatter than others for reasons you didn't want to believe. Most of the villagers that were in chains looked like lizard people, kobolds you think they were called. These ones had scales of light green and were considerably short. As you inspect the scene before you, one of the otters that was stomping through the village sudden turns towards you and shouts. He continues yelling, pointing towards you as a couple of others start approaching menacingly. You feel your heart skip a beat as your fight or flight instincts kick in. Backing up you reach for your slung rifle, only to find it won't budge from your back. Looking back you see the imposing figure of one of the otters, their furry paw firmly grasping the barrel of the rifle.

Thinking fast you wriggle out of the sling of the rifle, accidentally causing your backpack to fall to the ground and spill out it's contents. From the forest you saw a couple of more giant otters emerge. How did they get there?! Looking back to the town a small group of otters were still approaching, you were surrounded. Frantically searching for an opening you manage to find a gap in their formation that lead further into the town. Dashing past the two otters you could feel the rushing air where they just barely missed grabbing you. Running past hut after hut you thought you might escape the tall lumbering beasts. You keep running as you use the sounds of splintering wood and shattering ceramics to guide you away from the otter raiders.

Eventually you could see the open jungle again as you neared the border of the village but you stop in your tracks as a small group of kobolds run into view. They were screaming in a language you couldn't understand as they barreled toward you. You could hear stomping as the thing they were running from came into view, one of the otter raiders. You were about to turn and run when one of the kobolds collides with you and knocks you on your back. The kobold sounded like he was begging for help from you as he struggled to regain his balance. As you both were scrambling to get up however two furred paws wrap around the lizard-man and lifted him effortlessly in the air while a large foot-paw presses down onto your abdomen, pinning you to the ground.

As the otter lifts the kobold up to eye level, it speaks to it in a feminine voice using the same language the lizard-people were using. She sounded calm and collected but her tone made it sound like she was scolding the small kobold before her. Without warning she parted her jaws and lifted her captive towards her maw. You could only watch in shock as the kobold began disappearing inside her mouth with a series of wet slurps. With the lizard-person's upper body firmly lodged in her maw she began to swallow. Glk. Glk. Glk. More and more of the kobold began to vanish as her throat bulged. Tilting her head up she swallowed a few more times until you saw the pair of legs kicking in the air start to slide further into her mouth. The otter moaned in obvious pleasure as the bulge traveled down her throat until it came to rest in her belly, causing her gut to swell round and taut.

With the paw still firmly pressed against your body you could only squirm as she lowered her gaze down to you. Her breath was ragged and her eyes were filled with satisfaction as her swollen belly twitched and shifted slightly. She began to talk to you. It was the same language and it sounded like she was teasing you as she talked down to you in a slow, sultry voice. "P-please don't eat me..." Was all you could mutter.

Her eyes widened a bit at your words. "Human?" She plainly asked you.

"Y-yes?" You muttered.

She grinned as she bent down lower to you, inadvertently putting more pressure on you as you struggled against her paw. "I've never seen a human before!" She exclaimed. "I used to read all about your people! Hey, am I talking your language alright?"

The otter releases her foot-paw off you and sits into a kneeling position next to you with a thud. You catch your breath as you think of a reply, the otter staring down at you inquisitively. "Um, yes? I can u-understand you." In fact she spoke very fluently, it was probably a stroke of good luck that she happened to speak the one human language you knew. You couldn't help but feel intimated though when she breaks out into a toothy grin at your reply, her pearly whites reminding you of your situation. "P-please don't eat me though, I probably don't even taste that good!" You begged desperately.

"No way!" She exclaims. "I'm gonna take you back along with the other prisoners! Humans are pretty rare out here. In fact, I think you'll be our first ever human slave!"

"Slave?!" You blurt out. Slavery was all but abolished in your society and the last thing you thought that would happen to you from exploring the jungles would be getting enslaved. Uncertainty flooded your mind as you instinctively searched for another escape route. Seeing your fear the otter woman grabbed you and pulled you upright.

"However, if you try and escape like my little friend did here-" she said as she patted her rotund belly. "Then I won't hesitate in giving him some extra company." Grabbing your shoulders she pulled you face first into the cream-colored fur of her belly. Using her strength to pin you onto her taut stomach you could feel squirming from within, her prey obviously still alive and kicking. The belly vibrated as a loud gurgle reached your ears, the telltale sound of her body trying to digest the lively creature and break it down into fuel. As you push against her belly and chubby thighs you can't help but fearfully wonder how many other creatures have passed through the giant otter's jaws.

She giggled as she released you and stood up to her full height, her thick tail swinging playfully behind her. "Do you understand?"
